content.description: Start near the middle of the boulder on the only obvious flake/sloper-like holds at about chest height. Use bad feet to make a dynamic move left into a left-hand flake that is decent. Move up the flake and to the top of the boulder, traverse the lip to the very middle point of the boulder (highest point), and top out.
content.location: Near the middle of the boulder, there aren't many holds on the face. In fact, from a distance, it looks completely blank.

content.description: Sit start the low left arete of the tall face. Undercling right, and get a big jug up left. Follow the arete to mantel at the apex.
content.location: This ascends the arete left of Troll.

content.description: Valhalla is a lone glacial erratic with a seemingly-blank face in the middle of a beautiful Eastern Hemlock forest. If you're looking for a scenic boulder; this is the one. It's not very big, but the routes are solid.
